abstract: Should bank bondholders really be heading for the exits? In recent weeks the prices of some troubled banks’ subordinated debt have declined sharply and the cost of insuring it against default has risen. For example, some Citigroup and Bank of America subordinated debt has been trading, despite investment-grade ratings, at around 70 cents to 85 cents on the dollar, down in some cases from an earlier level above 90 cents.
